variants.Description in input context: parkin T240R, with a Thr→Arg mutation in RING1 domain
parkin R42P, with a mutation in Ubl-domain

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells and SH-SY5Y cells were maintained in DMEM supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum, streptomycin (100 µg/ml) and penicillin (100 U/ml). Transfections were performed using the FuGENE6 transfection reagent.

Readout description.Result Description: parkin T240R did not associate with UbcH7, indicating loss of E2 binding capability.
parkin R42P was capable of binding UbcH7, but failed to co-immunoprecipitate ubiquitinated proteins, suggesting a defect in target protein recognition.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Detection of co-immunoprecipitation with UbcH7 and ubiquitinated proteins.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Lack of co-immunoprecipitation with UbcH7 or ubiquitinated proteins.

Material used.Description: IP-parkin bound to anti-Myc IgG-linked protein A beads from extracts of MG132-treated SH-SY5Y or HEK293 cells transfected with pcDNA3.1(+)Myc-parkin.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant IP-parkin T240R did not support in vitro ubiquitination, indicating loss of E3 activity.
Mutant IP-parkin R42P did not support in vitro ubiquitination, indicating a defect in target protein recognition despite E2 binding capability.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type IP-parkin from SH-SY5Y cells showed ubiquitination activity when incubated with E1, E2 (UbcH7), and ubiquitin.

Basic negative control.Description: No ubiquitination signal was noted in the absence of E1, E2 (UbcH7), or IP-parkin.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Detection of high molecular weight ubiquitinated signals by autoradiography.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence of high molecular weight ubiquitinated signals by autoradiography.
